intro: Arabis saxicola var. elatior, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. This variety is known for its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces yellow or white flowers in early spring. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing rocky terrain.
